Posted By: EternalLurker (2/1/2010 7:14:57 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Kweane  
  
this does not work with archive trap, unless you are talking about just for milling  
  
you are searching someone elses library with extract, the wording on archive trap reads:   
"If an opponent searched his or her library this turn"  
  
  
meaning they have to search their own library, not have someone do it for them
posts.html:
@Kweane

this does not work with archive trap, unless you are talking about just for milling

meaning they have to search their own library, not have someone do it for them

posts.post_content:
It seems some cards were intentionally designed to be extremely annoying. It's bad enough having to allow your opponent to paw through your deck and see everything you have, spoiling all the surprises, but having to worry about it happening on the very first turn is just ridiculous.  
  
If someone pulls out an "Extract" on me, then in response, as a fast effect, I'm hurling their deck across the room.
posts.html:
